address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

did.abstract: Collection includes: Manuscript promissory note to Francis W. Pettygrove in the amount of $28.51, with 6% interest, Oregon City, May 25 1848. Francis Pettygrove (1812-1887): A native of Maine, Francis Pettygrove purchased William Overton's claim to half of the town site of Portland.

bioghist.p: Francis Pettygrove (1812-1887): A native of Maine, Francis Pettygrove purchased William Overton's claim to half of the town site of Portland.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes: Manuscript promissory note to Francis W. Pettygrove in the amount of $28.51, with 6% interest, Oregon City, May 25 1848.

acqinfo.p: Gift of Richard N. Corning, October 1977.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library prior to any use of reproductions. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use of reproductions may required seeking additional authorization from the copyright holders.

prefercite.p: Francis W. Pettygrove Promissory Note, Mss 1226, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.
